snippet: By ignoring political boundaries in favor of natural divisions, Harry Thurston paints a clearer picture of the plants and animals of the region, the ecological niches they inhabit and the problems tormenting them.
abstract: Cornelia Dean reviews book The Atlantic Coast: A Natural History by Harry Thurston.
lead_paragraph: By ignoring political boundaries in favor of natural divisions, Harry Thurston paints a clearer picture of the plants and animals of the region, the ecological niches they inhabit and the problems tormenting them.

headline.print_headline: From Newfoundland to the Gulf Stream Waters
headline.seo: ‘The Atlantic Coast’ - From Newfoundland to the Gulf Stream Waters
headline.main: From Newfoundland to the Gulf Stream Waters
